marginalia.anchor_text: Sampson Dolensis archiepiscopus & successor sancti Sampsonis qui de Britania maiori ad minorem transiit

position.marginalia_text: Sampson Meneuensis archiep[iscopu]s vide a[nn]o p[ri]mo regis Io[ann]is in Hovedeno Historico. At Eborace[n]sem Archiepi[scopu]m fuisse asserit Math. Paris. A[nn]o 1&o_super; regis Jo[ann]is

marginalia.translation: For St. Samson from St. David's, the archbishop, see Hoveden's History from the first year of King John. But in the first year of the reign of King John, Matthew Paris asserts he was the archbishop of York.

underline.text: & ipsius nauigationis socius in Britannia miraculis, & sanctitate refulsit
Sampson Dolensis archiepiscopus & successor sancti Sampsonis qui de Britania maiori ad minorem transiit, doctrina & sanctitate refulsit
